wikipedia_page.main: Joyce Dunbar (born 6 January 1944) is an English writer. She primarily writes books for children, and has published over seventy books. Dunbar is perhaps best known for Tell Me Something Happy Before I Go To Sleep, This Is The Star, and the Mouse and Mole series. She is the mother of the children's writer-illustrator Polly Dunbar.

response: Lynn is known for writing and illustrating children's books, including "All Day Long" and "All Night Long" Hodder & Stoughton; the "This Little Baby" series Orchard ("My Day Out", "My New Baby", "My New Potty", "My First Tooth"); "Babyfaces" series Orchard ("Baby's Food", "Baby's Toys", "Baby's Clothes", "Baby's Animals"); "Pickle" books Kingfisher ("Pickle and the Box", "Pickle and the Blanket", "Pickle and the Blocks" and "Pickle and the Ball"), as well as illustrating books by other authors such as Tony Bradman's "Billy and the Baby" and "Our Baby", Lorraine Kelly's "Numbers", "Colours", and "Opposites", Donna Bryant's One Day series (including "One Day at the Seaside" and "One day at Grandma's"); Sue Nicholls's "Bobby Shaftoe Clap Your Hands", Felicia Law's "Lost Baggage"', Joy Cowley, Joyce Dunbar's "Potatoes and Tomatoes"and David Hately's "Noah".

response: Mouse and Mole is a 1996 British television series devised by Joy Whitby's Grasshopper Productions. It was based on the series of children's books written by Joyce Dunbar and illustrated by James Mayhew which were first published in 1993. Originally envisaged as 26 x 5 minute episodes, only 19 were ever finished, although the soundtracks for the remaining seven episodes, created by Ben Baird at Aquarium Studios are still in existence.
